result.execSummary:
The defendant James Perry Peterson Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, DNA fees up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance due prior to the end of the Extended supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence, but to run concurrent with count two.

superMiscConds.notes:
No new law violations reaching the level of probable cause finding.
No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses or drug dealing.
AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a biological specimen (DNA) to State Crime Lab for testing.
As a convicted felon defendant shall never  be in possession of any firearms and weapons.  Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence, but to run concurrent with count one.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order faxed and mailed to:  Drug Abuse Correctional Center, Attn:  Stephanie, P. O. Box 36, Winnebago, WI  54985-0036

Filed, signed Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order-ERP.  

IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date.

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.

In all other respects, the original judgment herein is affirmed.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 11, Judge Swanson.  jm
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt: Count one.
Count two.

Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:   COURT SENTENCED Defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS, to run consecutive to any other sentence, but to run concurrent to Count 2 with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

The Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration AND the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Programs.

AS TO COUNT 2:  COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve 60 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, but to run concurrent to as to Count 1 with credit for 0 days time served.  

COURT ORDERED THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS AS TO THE EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, DNA fees up to 25% of prison funds with the balance due prior to the end of the Extended supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Maintain full time part time employment and or schooling.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment.
*  Random urine screens with no positive results. No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealings.
*  Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to State Crime Lab for testing.
*  As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms and weapons.
*  Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

Received and filed with court:
*  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence Form
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form

Defendant James Perry Peterson in court with attorney David P. Geraghty.  Defendant James Perry Peterson in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information withdrawn. Court will proceed with the original information previously filed.  

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

AS TO COUNT 2:    Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.
State's Witness List received and filed./ds
States' Requested Jury Instructions and Jury Instructions received and filed./ds
Notice of Motion and Motion to Amend Information received and filed./ds

Attorney David P. Geraghty in court, defendant James Perry Peterson not in court, in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed, and requests a trial date.  Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 10/23/2015 at 9:30 am, and for jury trial on 10/26/2015 at 9:00 am, branch 44.  Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.  aw  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Anne A. Devitt in court, defendant James Perry Peterson not in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Darnieder in court for attorney David P. Geraghty.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Zachary Wittchow.
Attorney Geraghty has been privately retained.  Stipulation and order for substitution of attorney, received and filed.  Attorney Devitt has turned over all discovery.   Court allows attorney Devitt to withdraw.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 7/7/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw

  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed with court.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Court entered a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the Defendant.

Defendant James Perry Peterson in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant James Perry Peterson in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
